The caption accurately captures the general sequence of events, but it could be more precise about the spatial dynamics and transitions. The shift from a "wide shot" to a "medium shot" is not instantaneous as the phrase "at which point" implies; it's a smooth, continuous dolly-in, where the camera moves forward, following the woman as she walks, causing the frame to tighten around her before she reaches the stairs. The description of the woman remaining in the "foreground" during her descent is also slightly misleading; while the camera stays close, she is actively moving away from her starting plane and deeper into the scene, transitioning from the foreground to the middle ground relative to the top of the staircase. Furthermore, the initial description of the bus as just "moving" is incomplete; the bus is moving from right to left across the frame, eventually exiting on the left. Finally, the caption fails to mention that as the camera focuses on the woman, the building and street in the background become soft-focused, shifting the viewer's attention entirely to her and the staircase architecture.
